raw_entry:
WILLIAM RANDOLPH of
Goochland Co., 2,400 acs. in sd
Co., N side Rivanna Riv., below
the Mountain Falls, up Mountain
Falls Cr.; adj. the Mountains &
Robert Adams; 1 Jul 1735, p.1.
£12.

JAMES STUART, 400 © acs.
Hanover Co., adj. Dansie &
Hudson; 1 Jul 1735, p.3. £2.

JOHN HENRY of Hanover Co.,
Gent., 1,250 acs. in sd Co.; on
both sides of the Main Fork of
James Riv., on the North Fork of
James Riv., on the South Fork of
sd North Fork, across Buck
Mountain Cr.; 1 Jul 1735, p.5.
£6.85.

LODOWICK ELAM, 400 acs.
Goochland Co.; S side of James
Riv., bet. Skin Quarter Cr. &
Butterwood Cr.; in Henrico Co.
Line, adj. Thomas Locket; 1 Jul
1735, p.7. £2.

JAMES WILLIAMS, 500 acs.
Orange Co., on the Main Br. &
crossing Several Brs. of Muddy
Run; 7 Jul 1735, p.9. £2.810.

JAMES WATSON, 1,750 acs.
Hanover Co.; both sides of Harris’s
Cr. & Beaver Cr.; adj. John
Thomas, Col. Meriwether, John
Mickie & John Rice; 7 Jul 1735,
p.l1. £6.S15. 400 acs. part
formerly Gtd. sd James Watson 25
Aug 1731 [PB 14 p.225].

CHRISTOPHER ZIMMERMAN
(ZIMBERMAN), 440 acs. Orange
Co.; in the Great Fork of the
Rappahannock Riv.; on the Point of
a Fork of Potato Run, adj. Joseph
Cooper; 7 Jul 1735, p.14. 200 acs.
part formerly Gtd. sd Christopher
Zimmerman [Cimberman PB 12
p.483] 24 Jun 1726 & the residue
Gtd. him 25 Aug 1731 [Simberman
PB 14 p.250].

BENJAMIN CAVE, 200 acs.
Orange Co.; in Fork of the
Rappidanne Riv.; adj. Bland
Ballard, John Wisdom, Charles
Blunt & Darby Queen; 7 Jul 1735,
p.16. £1.

THOMAS MONRO, 400 acs.
Orange Co., adj. Francis Thornton
Stirling Tract on Cannon’s Riv., on
the Rush Riv.; adj. William
Covington & Benjamin Berryman;
7 Jul 1735, p.17. £2.
ISAAC NORMAND, JUNR., 200
acs. Orange Co.; on the lower side
of Stonehouse Riv., up Hazel Riv.;
adj. Thomas Stonehouse, Courtney
Normand & Thomas Nicholson; 7
Jul 1735, p.19. £1.

BENJAMIN JOHNSON, 200 acs.
Hanover Co., on both — sides
Machunk Cr. & Turkey Run; adj.
Timothy Dalton & Capt. Dansie; 7
Jul 1735, p.21. £1.

RICHARD KIRKLAND of Pr.
Geo. Co., 200 acs. in sd Co.; on N
side of Jones Hole Sw. above his
Settlement, by the Road, adj.
Titmash; 7 Jul 1735, p.23. £1.

DAVID WINEFORD, 182 acs.
Goochland Co., both sides of
Indian Camp Br. of Deep Cr., on
the S side of James Riv.; adj.
Francis Eppes, John Pleasant,
Stephen Hughes & William Mayo;
7 Jul 1735, p.25. £1.

EDMOND FRANKLIN, 281 acs.
Amelia Co.; on S_ side of
Appamattox Riv. near the Mouth of
Licking Place Gully, upon Walkers
Cr., above George Marchbank; 7
Jul 1735, p.27. £1.S10.

THOMAS WATTS & JOHN
ZACHORY, 333 acs. Orange Co.,
in the Fork of the Rappidanne Riv.;
adj. Dickson, James Barber & Blan
Ballard; 7 Jul 1735, p.28. £1.815.

WILLIAM DUFF of King Geo.
Co., 2,400 acs. Orange Co., N
side the South Fork of Goard Vine
Riv., by Berryman’s Commodity
Mountain, on Duffs Mountain,
crossing Duffs Run & down Beaver
Dam Run; 7 Jul 1735, p.30. £2.
2,000 acs. part formerly Gtd. sd
William Duff by Pat. 17 Sep 1731
[PB 12 p.348, PB 13 p.299-300 &
PB 14 p.325].

NICHOLAS MERIWETHER,
Gent., 1,020 acs. Goochland Co.,
on both sides of Rivanna Riv., by
the mouth of Meadow Cr.; adj.
Charles Lynch, John Carter Esq. &
Peter Jefferson; 19 Jul 1735, p.33.
400 acs. formerly gtd. Charles
Lynch 20 Jun 1733 [Linch PB 15
p.35] & by sd Lynch sold &
conveyed unto sd Nicholas
Meriwether; 220 acs. Gtd. sd
Nicholas Meriwether by Pat. 30
Nov 1734 [21 Nov 1734 in PB 15
p.370].

EDWARD BOOKER of Amelia
Co., Gent., 3,050 acs. in sd Co.,
on Flatt Cr., by Anderson’s Path,
adj. John Farguson; 19 Jul 1735,
p.35. 2,050 acs. part formerly
Gtd. sd Booker by Pat. 28 Sep
1728 & 1,000 acs. ptd. by sd
Booker 31 Jul 1732 [PB 13 p.290
& PB 14 p.458 Henrico Co.].

JOHN HYDE SANDERS, 400 acs.
formerly in Henrico Co. but now
Goochland Co.; on Stovalls Br.;
adj. Bartholomew Stovall; 19 Jul
1735, p.38. £2. Gtd. George
Stovall of Henrico Co. on 16 Jun
1727 [PB 13 p.89] & sold by him
to John Sanders; both Stovall &
Sanders failed to make cultiv. &
improv. and Gtd. to John Hyde
Sanders.

ABRAHAM LEWIS, 400 acs., in
Goochland Co., at the head of
Meadow Cr. on the S side of the
Rivanna Riv., E side of Piny
Mountain, adj. sd Abraham Lewis;
19 Jul 1735, p.40. £2.

PETER FORE, 125 acs. Goochland
Co., on both sides of Manacan GE:
adj. sd Peter Fore, James
Robinson, Peter Soublett, Joseph
Woodson, William Randolph &
Anthony Rapin; 19 Jul 1735, p.42.
15 Shill.

ABRAHAM LEWIS, 400 acs.
Goochland Co., both sides of
Meadow Cr. on the S side of the
Rivanna Riv.; 19 Jul 1735, p.44.
£2.

HENRY CLARK, 150 acs. Is. of
Wight Co. on S side of Maherin
Riv., W side of the Great Sw.; adj.
Samuel Clark, sd Henry Clark &
William Duglas; 19 Jul 1735, p.46.
15 Shill.

GEORGE WHITE, 145 acs.
Brunswick Co. on N side of Waqua
Cr.; 19 Jul 1735, p.47. 15 Shill.

ABRAHAM VENABLES, Gent.,
1,500 acs. Goochland Co. on the
South Garden among the Mountains
on Hardware Riv. South Br.; 19
Jul 1735, p.49. £7.S10.

ROBERT SLAUGHTER, 35 acs.
Orange Co., in the Great Fork of
the Rappahannock Riv., on the
Mountain run; adj. sd Slaughter,
Francis Thornton, & Henry Field;
19 Jul 1735, p.512. 5 Shill.

GEORGE WALTON, 1,150 acs.
Brunswick Co., on Quarrel Sw. &
White Oak Sw.; adj. Richard
Ledbetter & Henry Ledbetter; 19
Jul 1735, p.53. £5. 180 acs. part
formerly Gtd. sd George Walton on
28 Sep 1728 [John Walton PB 13
p.360] & by the sd Walton sold &
conveyed to the sd George Walton.

FRANCIS STROTHER, 654 acs.
Hanover Co. on the S side of the
Northanna_ Riv.; adj. Thomas
Prestwood, John Wilson & Martin
Devenport; 19 Jul 1735, p.56. £2.
Gtd. Thomas Carr of King Wm.
Co., Gent. for 400 acs. by Pat. 4
Mar 1725/26 [PB 13 p.2] & by him
sold to Francis Strother by Deeds
in Hanover Co. on 6 Feb 1729/30,
the Residue being Surplus found
within the Pat.

JOHN BOW, 400 acs. Henrico Co.
on N side of James Riv.; adj. John
Watson, James Hambleton & the sd
Bow; 19 Jul 1735, p.58. £2.

PETER JEFFERSON, Gent., 1,000
acs. Goochland Co., S side of the
Rivanna Riv. including part of a
Mountain, against the Sandy Falls;
adj. Nicholas Meriwether Esqr. &
John Carter Esqr.; 19 Jul 1735,
p.60. £5.

THOMAS SPENCER, 200 acs.
Pr. Geo. Co., bet. Hill & Nash on
Beaver Pond Br. of Flatt Cr.; 26
Jul 1735, p.62. £1.

EDWARD HILL, 250 acs. Amelia
Co., on Beaver Pond Br. of Flatt
Cr.; adj. John Hill’s bought of
Moses Farguson; 26 Jul 1735,
p.65. £1.85.

JOHN TUCKER, 200 acs. Amelia
Co. on Lower side of Winticomaick
Cr., below the old Path; 26 Jul
1735, p.67. £1.

HENRY MANWERING, 125 acs.
Is. of Wight Co. on S side of
Spring Sw.; adj. Adam Taply; 26
Jul 1735, p.69. 15 Shill.

HENRY MANWERING, 125 acs.
Surry Co. on S side of main Black
Water Sw.; SE side of Wall’s Br.,
adj. Richard Wall; 26 Jul 1735,
p.71. 15 Shill.

THOMAS LAWTON, 180 acs.
Goochland Co. on the Brs. of the
Upper Manacan Cr.; adj. Redford
Maxey, William Maxey, John
Maxey & Nathaniel Basset dec’d;
26 Jul 1735, p.73. £1.

CHARLES HUDSON,  Gent.,
2,000 acs. Goochland Co. on the
Brs. of Ivy Cr. on S side of
Rivanna Riv., adj. Michael
Holland; 26 Jul 1735, p.75. £10.

JOHN TALLY, 974 acs. Amelia
Co. on upper side of Deep Cr.,
down West’s Cr.; adj. William
Crawley, George Stegall & William
Rowlet; 26 Jul 1735, p.77. £5.

DAVID LEWIS and JOEL
TERREL, 700 acs. Goochland Co.
on the S Brs. of the Rivanna Riv.,
including the Piny Mountain, near
the W side of Meadow Cr.; adj. sd
Lewis & Terrel, Abraham Lewis &
Michael Holland; 26 Jul 1735,
p.79-91.  £3.S10. — [Note: The
Scribe skipped p.80-p.89.]

RICHARD JONES, Gent., 1,623
acs. Amelia Co., up Wests Cr. &
Rockey Br., adj. William Mote; 26
Jul 1735, p.92. £8.S5.

JOHN BRUCE, 400 acs. Orange
Co., on the first Fork of Robinson
Riv., on a Point by a br. of Dark
Run; 1 Aug 1735, p.93. £2.

JAMES FLETCHER, 190 acs.
Amelia Co., on upper side of
Woody Cr. of Deep Cr., adj.
Edward Mitchel;
p.95. £1.
1 Aug 1735,

THOMAS BROOKES, 400 acs.
Amelia Co., on the upper side of
the Little Cr. of Appamattox Riv.
next below Smack’s Cr., above
Booker’s Road, adj. John Blanchet:
1 Aug 1735, p.97. £2.

JAMES COCK of Henrico Co.,
Gent., 88 acs. in sd Co. on N side
of James Riv. & Shoccoe Cr., on E
side of Cannon’s Br., up W side of
Johnston’s Br.; adj. Luke Smith,
John Gun, Thomas Wood; within
39 foot of sd Cock’s Dwelling
House; 1 Aug 1735, p.99. 10
Shill.

THOMAS NUNNALLY, 504 acs.
Pr. Geo. Co. on S side of Stony
Cr. & lower side of Rockey Run,
adj. Richard Leadbiter; 1 Aug
1735, p.102. £2.810.

HUTCHINSON BURTON, 400
acs. Henrico Co. on N side of
James Riv., on N side a Br. of
Lower Westham; adj. Col. William
Randolph, sd Burton, Benjamin
Clark & William Gaudin; 1 Aug
1735, p.104. £2.

THOMAS JONES, JUNR., 200
acs. Amelia Co. on Branches of S$
Fork of Flatt Cr., below Bobbitt’s
path; 1 Aug 1735, p.106. £1.

JAMES BAUGH, 640 acs. Pr.
Geo. Co. on N. side of Second Sw.
of Black water, by Peter Mitchel’s
path; adj. sd James Baugh & Lewis
Green; 1 Aug 1735, p.107. £3.85.

EDWARD TRAYLOR, 395 acs.
Pr. Geo. Co. in the Fork of
Mawhipponock Cr. adj. Leadbitor
Jones; 1 Aug 1735, p.109. £2.

BENJAMIN CLARK, 400 acs.
Henrico Co. on N side of James
Riv., up the S side of Ufnam
Brook; adj. Col. William
Randolph, Hutchinson Burton &
Richard Moseby; 1 Aug 1735,
p.112. £2.

DANIEL FITZPATRICK and
JOHN RYALL, 400 acs. Henrico
Co. on N side of James Riv.; adj.
Mr Michael Holland, William
Britton, & Hunt; 1 Aug 1735,
p.113. £2.

ZACHARIAH GIBBS, 400 acs.
Orange Co. in the Fork of the
Rappidanne Riv., on the Mouth of
a Br. of Beautiful Run; 9 Aug
1735, p.115. £2.

JOHN WATSON, 395 acs. Henrico
Co. on N side of James Riv.; adj.
Mr Holland, & Thomas
Boatwright; 9 Aug 1735, p.117.
£2.

JOHN LATHAM, 600 acs. Orange
Co., on Cabbin Br. & Hasel Riv.;
adj. Francis Thornton’s Sherrive
Moore tract, John Hues, Thomas
Stonehouse, & Nicholson; 9 Aug
1735, p.119. £3.

JAMES TUTT, 700 acs. Orange
Co., in the Great Fork of the
Rappahannock Riv., S side of
Muddy Run; 9 Aug 1735, p.121.
£3.S10.

DAVID LESUEUR, 51 acs.
Goochland Co. on S side of James
Riv. bet. the 2 Manacan Creeks;
adj. sd Lesueur, John Timson &
Thomas Dickens; 9 Aug 1735,
p.123. (The sd Tract being part of
the Land allotted to the French
Refugees)

JOHN MINOR of Spotsyl. Co.,
Gent., 400 acs. Hanover Co., on
upper side of North Fork of North
Fork of the James Riv.; 9 Aug
1735, p.124. £2.

JOHN BLEWFORD, 400 acs.
Orange Co., in the Fork of the
Rappidanne Riv., on Beautiful Run;
9 Aug 1735, p.126. £2.

JOHN WALLER, JUNR. of
Spotsyl. Co., 400 acs. Hanover
Co., both sides of the North Fork
of North Fork of James Riv.; adj.
Mr William Carr & Mr John
Minor; 9 Aug 1735, p.128. £2.

WILLIAM CLEMENT, 400 acs.
Amelia Co., on lower side of Little
Cr., by the dry beaverpond; adj.
Richard Jones, Stephen Beasly,
Beasley & Hayes; 9 Aug 1735,
p.130. £2.

ROBERT STEWART & JOHN
HOBSON, 1,200 acs. in St. Marks
Par. Orange Co. in the Goard Vine
Fork, up Hasell Riv.; adj. Anthony
Strother; 9 Aug 1735, p.132. £6.

ANTHONY THORNTON, Gent.,
1,000 acs. Orange Co., on the head
Brs. of the Rappidanne Riv., on
Conway’s Riv.; adj. a Pat. Gitd.
Francis Conway & the sd Anthony
Thornton called Invernness; 9 Aug
1735, p.134. £5.

RICHARD JONES, Gent., 1,287
acs. Amelia Co. on lower side of
Deep Cr., by Spinner’s Br., by the
path, down Seller Fork of Deep
Cr.; adj. William Short & sd
Jones; 9 Aug 1735, p.137. £4.85.
452 acs. part formerly Gtd. sd
Richard Jones [Junr.] 28 Sep 1730
[PB 13 p.535].

HUMPHREY HILL, Gent., 1,049
acs. Hanover Co., on both sides of
Golden Mine Cr., N & S Forks of
Golden Mine Cr. & S side of
Cattail Br.; adj. Charles Stevens,
John Poindexter, Col. Meriwether,
Henry Mills, Mr Joseph Temple &
Richard Yarbrough; 9 Aug 1735,
p.139. £4.85. 400 acs. part
formerly Gtd. George Woodroof 7
Feb. 1727/28 [PB 13 p.191] & by
him Sold & Conveyed to
Humphrey Hill by Deeds in
Hanover Co. Court 4 Oct 1728.

PETER JONES, Gent., 2,021 acs.
Amelia Co., on lower side of Deep
Cr., on Spinners Br. & upper side
of second br. below Spinners; adj.
Richard Jones Junr., Uriah
Chiswell & John Clay; 9 Aug
1735, p.142. £7.85. 587 acs.
Gtd. sd Peter Jones by Pat. 28 Sep
1728 [PB 11 p.112, Peter Jones
Junr. & PB 13 p.374 Peter Jones,
Minister].

BENJAMIN WALKER, 200 acs. in
St. Margaret’s Par. Caroline Co.,
on W side of White’s Run, by a
Path about 200 yards above his
(Partlo’s) House; adj. John
Nichols, John Martin & John Ellis;
9 Aug 1735, p.144. £1. Gtd. John
Partlo by Pat. 27 Sep 1729 [PB 13
p.415] who failed to make Cultiv.
& Improv.

WILLIAM JACKSON of Henrico
Co., 400 acs. Amelia Co., on
Beaver Pond Br. of Deep Cr. adj.
Thomas Neale, William Marshall,
James Long & Yeo Avery; 18 Aug
1735, p.146. £2.

HOWARD CASH, 250 acs.
Goochland Co., both sides of
Meadow Cr. of the S side of the
Rivanna Riv.; adj. Abraham Lewis,
David Lewis & Joel Terrell; 18
Aug 1735, p.148. £1.85.

JAMES ANDERSON, 150 acs. Pr.
Geo. Co. on N. side of Little
Nottoway Riv. near below the bent;
18 Aug 1735, p.150. 15 Shill.

WILLIAM RENNILDS,
ELIZABETH ALFORD the wife of
Salvator Alford, and MARY
RENNILDS, Spinster, 300 acs.
Goochland Co., on S side of John’s
Cr. Falling into James Riv. from
the South; on W side of Little Cr.;
18 Aug 1735, p.152. £1.S10.

JOSEPH KING, 400 acs.
Goochland Co., S side of the
Rivanna Riv. against a Small
Island, crossing Rock Fish Cr.,
adj. Daniel Jones; 18 Aug 1735,
p.154. £2.

ROBERT TANNER, 200 acs.
Orange Co., at the Great
Mountains, on the S_ side of
Robinson Riv., up a large Run;
adj. Henry Snyder; 18 Aug 1735,
p.156. for the Imp. of 4 pers.:
Catherine Turner, Mary Turner,
Christopher Turner & Christianna
Turner.

JOHN TAYLOR of Pr. Geo. Co.,
303 acs. in sd Co., on lower side
of Deep Cr. above the Sappone
Indians Cabbins, up Winningham’s
Cr., at the Fork of a Small Spring
Br.; 18 Aug 1735, p.158. £1.810.

JOSEPH WALKER, 400 acs.
Goochland Co., on the head Brs. of
Fork Cr.; adj. John Syme dec’d. &
Frances Clark, in Hanover Co.
line; 18 Aug 1735, p.159. £2.

JOHN WALKER, 400 acs.
Goochland Co., at the Head of a
Br. of the Byrd against the head
Brs. of Fork Cr., E side a Dry Br.;
adj. Joseph Walker; 18 Aug 1735,
p.161. £2.

CHARLES LYNCH, 400 acs.
Goochland Co., both sides of
Moor’s Cr., S side of the Rivanna
Riv., adj. John Carter Esqr. &
Nicholas Meriwether Esqr.; 18 Aug
1735, p.163. £2.

CHARLES LYNCH, 325 acs.
Goochland Co.; N side of Rivanna
Riv. near the Mountains, on E side
a Run of Carrell’s Cr. & crossing
a Run of Mountain Fall’s Cr.; adj.
Robert Adams, Daniel Desoin &
William Randolph; 18 Aug 1735,
p.165. £1.810.

ROBERT NAPPIER, JUNR., 200
acs. Goochland Co. on Flemings
Park Cr., adj. John
Hankins/Haukins; 18 Aug 1735,
p.167. £1.

WILLIAM PIERCE, 100 acs.
Orange Co., in the Fork of the
Rappidanne Riv.; adj. John Rucker,
William Eddings, George Essome
& Thomas Rucker; 18 Aug 1735,
p.168. 10 Shill.

WILLIAM BARTLETT, 450 acs.
in Par. of St. Mark Par. Orange
Co.; adj. Edward Franklin, Richard
Thomas, John Taylor & sd William
Bartlett; 18 Aug 1735, p.170.
£2.85.

THOMAS BASSETT, 400 acs.
Goochland Co., on W side of Deep
Cr., S side of the James Riv.; adj.
Bowler Cocke, Alexander
Kilpatrick, James Roberts &
George Stoval; 18 Aug 1735,
p.173.

LAWRENCE BROWN of Henrico
Co., 400 acs. Pr. Geo. Co., upper
side of Smacks Cr.; adj. Richard
Walthall, George Wilson, Peter
Ragsdale & William Dunnevant; 18
Aug 1735, p.174. £2.

DANIEL WILLMORE, 400 acs.
Goochland Co., above Fine Cr., on
the S side of James Riv.; adj.
Daniel Stoner, Charles Realy, John
Pleasant, Nathaniel Bassett dec’d.,
& Stephen Woodson; 18 Aug 1735,
p.176. £2.

JOSEPH HAWKES, 290 acs.
Amelia Co., up Kitts Horsepen Br.
of the Seller Fork of Deep Cr.; adj.
Christopher Hinton & Charles
Williamson; 18 Aug 1735, p.178.
£1.810.

DANIEL FITZPATRICK, 393 acs.
Henrico Co., N side of the James
Riv. & both sides Rockey Br.; adj.
John Watson & William Patman:
18 Aug 1735, p.180. £2.

AMBROSE JOSHUA SMITH,
1,200 acs. Hanover Co., both sides
of Prillies [Pritties] Cr. & at it’s
Middle Fork, adj. Capt. Joseph
Martin; 18 Aug 1735, p.182. £6.

JOSEPH TEMPLE of King Wm.
Co., Gent., 1,600 acs. Hanover
Co., both sides of Ducking Hole
Sw., in the Low Grounds of
Golden Mine Cr.; adj. Capt. Carr,
Joseph Bickley, Henry Mills &
Charles Stevens; 9 Sep 1735,
p.184. £6. 400 acs. part formerly
Gtd. Ambrose Joshua Smith by Pat.
28 Sep 1728 [PB 13 p.310] & by
him sold & Conveyed to Charles
Forgitt by Deeds in Hanover Co.
Court 3 Sep 1731, for want of
Cultiv. & Improv. became
forfeited. 400 acs. other part
formerly Gtd. Joseph Temple by
Pat. 20 Aug 1734 [PB 13 p.417 &
PB 15 p.294].

FRANCIS KIRTLETT, 700 acs.
Orange Co., in the great fork of
the Rappahannock Riv., N side the
Mountain Run; 10 Sep 1735,
p.187. For the Imp. of 11 pers.:
John Finlason, James Wood, John
McCoy, Thomas Burk, John
Vinyard, Joseph Cotton, George
Home, John Floyd, James
McCulley, Charles Robinson, &
Robert Green as also for 15 Shill.

FRANCIS KIRTLETT, 400 acs.
Orange Co., in the Great Fork of
the Rappahannock Riv., at William
Beverley’s Meander Run Mountain
Land; 10 Sep 1735, p.189. £2.

ROBERT GREEN, 400 acs.
Orange Co., in the little Fork of
the Rappahannock Riv., by a Br. of
Crooked Run, adj. Anthony Scott;
10 Sep 1735, p.191. £2.

WILLIAM POLLARD, JUNR. of
King Wm. Co., 450 acs. Orange
Co.; down the North Fork of
Beaverdam Run; adj. William
Tayloe, Samuel Smith & Robert
Bickers; 10 Sep 1735, p.193.
£2.85.

LAWRENCE FRANKLIN, 400
acs. Orange Co.; by William
Bartlett; 10 Sep 1735, p.195. £2.

GEORGE ROBERTS, 400 acs.
Orange Co., in the Great Fork of
the Rappahannock Riv., by a Br.
called the Batchelors Dividing
Corner; adj. Henry Field &
William Beverley; 10 Sep 1735,
p.197. £2.

ANTHONY STROTHER, 50 acs.
Orange Co., on Double Fox
Mountains; adj. Benjamin Rush; 10
Sep 1735, p.199. 5 Shill.

THOMAS MOREMAN, 400 acs.
Goochland Co., on the Brs. of
Meadow Cr. & Ivy Cr., S side of
the Rivanna Riv.; 10 Sep 1735,
p.201. £2.

HENRY WILLIS, Gent., 270 acs.
Orange Co., on the head Brs. of
the Mine Run; adj. Edward Haily
& Parson Jones; 10 Sep 1735,
p.203. £1.S10.

HENRY WILLIS, Gent., 400 acs.
Orange Co.; in the little Fork of
the Rappahannock Riv.; down the
main Indian Run; 10 Sep 1735,
p.206. £2.

THOMAS NEALE, 400 acs.
Amelia Co., on both sides of the
South fork of Beaverpond Br. of
Deep Cr., adj. John Neale &
Thomas Branch; 10 Sep 1735,
p.206. £2.

THOMAS MOREMAN, 250 acs.
Goochland Co., both sides of
Rivanna Riv. Middle Br. including
the Indian Grave Low Grounds; 10
Sep 1735, p.208. £1.85.

THOMAS RAVENSCROFT of Pr.
Geo. Co., Gent., 45 acs.
Brunswick Co. near the Court
House; adj. John Rose, Tims, &
Ravenscroft; 10 Sep 1735, p.210.
5 Shill.

ROBERT BUMPUS, 150 acs.
Amelia Co., on the lower side of
the Main Deep Cr., at the mouth of
the first Br. below William
Edmonds’s House; 10 Sep 1735,
p.212. 15 Shill.

CHARLES MOREMAN, 400 acs.
Goochland Co., at a Fork of the
Rivanna Riv. near the Blue
Mountains; 10 Sep 1735, p.213.
£2.

WILLIAM EDDINGS, 712 acs.
Orange Co.; adj. William Robinson
& sd Eddings; 10 Sep 1735, p.215.
£2. 312 acs. part formerly Gtd. sd
William Edings 30 Jun 1726 [PB
12 p.492 on the Mine Run & the
Pike Run].

JOHN ELLIS, JUNIOR, 166 acs.
Amelia Co., up Flatt Cr. & it’s
North Fork; 10 Sep 1735, p.218.
£1.

CHARLES LYNCH,
Goochland Co., both sides of
Hardware Riv. adj. Charles
Hudson; 10 Sep 1735, p.219.
£1.S10.

[Note: The Alexander Ross &
Morgan Bryan allotment for 70,000
acres is like the Vanmater-Hite
allottment of Sherrando Land found
in Patent Book 15 and at the rate of
1,000 acres per family. The
following reference was included in
the next Patents, all dated 12 Nov
1735: Know Ye that for divers
good causes and Considerations but
more Especially for the
Consideration mentioned in an
Order of our Lieutenant Governor
(William Gooch) in Council of our
Colony and Dominion of Virginia
bearing date 23 April 1735
Granting Leave to Alexander Ross
and Morgan Bryan to Survey in
Such Manner as They should think
fit 1,000 Acres of Land for each
Family of 70 Families by them
brought into our sd Colony and
Settled upon the Lands in the said
Order mentioned and to Sue out
Patents for the same]
